body:
It's not just NeoVim... for me it disappears in normal ZSH shell...

[![asciicast](https://asciinema.org/a/SciyUWI6u7eSJX49faYToor4C.svg)](https://asciinema.org/a/SciyUWI6u7eSJX49faYToor4C)
Getting the same issue as @sQVe. Are there some new configuration variables we should be aware of? I haven't updated mine since 0.3.0.

I've start noticing the same issue in neovim (in my case, since in fish shell cursor is fine). Alacritty respects the cursor colors in my config at startup, but it's stops doing so after some time spending in neovim ( 1 - 2 hours, maybe I'm lucky and not getting it triggered very fast).

That looks extremely odd and I'm not able to reproduce it at all. I think some more background information might help out here.

When you say it's hard to reproduce, do you mean this rarely happens? Or does it happen reliably, but it seems to happen after an arbitrary amount of time?

Also does this happen with every cursor, or do only certain cursors like the underline and beam go invisible? Or only the block cursor? If you try changing the cursor using `printf "\e[?1Xq"` (replace X with 1/3/5), are all the cursors invisible or can you get it to show up again with certain cursors?

Does `reset` fix this issue?

> I also now noted that the cursor does not respect my set color.

Does this also only happen after a certain time, or will these never get accepted?

If a47d716daace7c197392854754406a06454ec380 broke this for you that would certainly be very surprising to me. I would have expected 371d13f8ef95157c97f7de9964bcbc89d4a8e930 to cause this problem.

Can someone else maybe help with bisecting? I'd be curious if a47d716 is actually the culprit.

I should clarify, the issue is only happening to me while inside Neovim. I just ran `reset` and it _seems_ to have fixed the issue. If it happens again I'll keep an eye out for any patterns that trigger it.

@chrisduerr It's hard to reproduce because it seems to happen randomly, at least for me. It does happen quite quickly though. I had to restart my terminal around 30-40 times today, 8 hour work day.

I've only seen an issue with the "insert cursor", i.e. the narrow line cursor. 

The cursor color had the same behavior as above. At first it works and when the insert cursor disappears the cursors are reverted to default setting.

I'll try to check the rest later today. ðŸ‘Š

If `reset` fixes the issue that would at least indicate that there's some terminal state which gets corrupted. Though getting the exact commit breaking this would probably still help out a ton.

I currently don't have any clue where this could be coming from, so anything that would help me repro or narrow down the issue would be extremely helpful. So far the only reported platform is Arch with X11, is anyone here not running X11?
Yes, I have the same issue when using neovim on my mac. And in my case it happens immediately when I open neovim.

Also seeing something similar on neovim + tmux immediately after opening neovim. Not only the cursor disappears, but the screen also goes blank (and different parts of it show up and go blank as I navigate through the file). Testing on Mac. Interestingly enough, if I open neovim with no plugins/custom configurations (``nvim -u NONE``), the issue is gone. So it works fine with barebone neovim, but it also works fine when using other terminal emulators.

I'll try to identify which neovim configuration/plugin is triggering the issue and I'll see if I can find some time to bisect alacritty too
I have the same issue on Fedora, although not reliably. I tried compiling with your debug statements, and it stopped happening :/
Cannot reproduce on a47d716daace7c197392854754406a06454ec380 . Was using this commit all day.

I've done some testing under gdb and figured out that this [`if`](https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/blob/e9813031f6e308984cb5547aa1049839cb75745f/src/term/mod.rs#L379) in pair with its `else` returns absolutely the same things whether cursor final colors are broken or not, so probably the colors are fine here.

In my test I was moving from `(0,0)` cell in alacritty to `(1,0)`, both times from the same line in the file. CursorStyle - block, `cursor.cursor == Rgb(171,178, 191)`, `cursor.text == Rgb(40,44,52)`. Compiled alacritty with `--debug` and used `rust-gdb` as a debugger. The results of examining `return` statements with gdb `p` command are in the file. `If` branch is marked with `if:` and `else` with `else:` 
[log_next.txt](https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/files/3110369/log_next.txt)

@kchibisov @chrisduerr 
For me a47d716 is fine, cfc20d4f34 introduced the problem.
